member.name: P:Mastercam.IO.ViewManager.CoordinateDisplay
member.summary: Gets or set the plane (view) coordinate display mode.
member.param: MILL_COORD, LATHE_COORD_X or LATHE_COORD_D.
member.value:
If the setting value is not one of the these valid choices -
The setting will default to the MILL_COORD display.
0 = MILL_COORD for Mill coordinates: XYZ
1 = LATHE_COORD_X for Lathe radial coordinates: XZY
2 = LATHE_COORD_D for Lathe diameter coordinates: DZY

member.name: M:Mastercam.GeometryUtility.GeometryManipulationManager.CombineViews
member.summary: Perform a "silent" Combine Views operation on the active database.

member.name: M:Mastercam.GeometryUtility.GeometryManipulationManager.MoveGroupGeometryToLevel(Mastercam.Database.Types.GroupSelectionMask,System.Int32)
member.summary: Move 'grouped' geometry to level.
member.param: The type(s) of selection groups to search for.
The target Level# (move "to").
member.remarks:
This method resets the Level# of all current entities that match the specified Group Type; Result and/or Group.
This only affects geometry that is already committed to Mastercam's database!
It does NOT effect the state of any NET-Hook side geometry objects. That is why it can be "fast".
member.returns: The number of entities that were copied, or -1 if the specified level# was not valid.

member.name: M:Mastercam.GeometryUtility.GeometryManipulationManager.MoveSelectedGeometryToLevel(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Move all selected geometry to a level.
member.remarks:
This method resets the Level# of all currently 'selected' entities to the specified destination level.
This only affects geometry that is already committed to Mastercam's database! It does NOT effect the state of any NET-Hook side geometry objects. That is why it can be "fast".
member.param: The target Level# (move "to" level).
Clear the 'selection' on the entities when done?
member.returns: The number of entities that were copied, or -1 if the specified level# was not valid.

member.name: M:Mastercam.GeometryUtility.GeometryManipulationManager.CopySelectedGeometryToLevel(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copy all selected geometry to a level.
member.remarks:
This method does an "in-place" XForm translate on ALL selected entities (regardless of their Level) which makes copies and then scans the database for all RESULT GROUP entities and resets their Level# to the specified destination level.
This only affects geometry that is already committed to Mastercam's database! It does NOT effect the state of any NET-Hook side geometry objects. That is why it can be "fast".
member.param: The target Level# (copy "to").
Clear the 'selection' on the entities when done?
member.returns: The number of entities that were copied, or -1 if the specified level# was not valid.

member.name: M:Mastercam.GeometryUtility.GeometryManipulationManager.ScaleGeometry(Mastercam.Math.Point3D,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: XForm-Scale all of the 'selected' geometry entities.
member.remarks:
NOTE!
Any Geometry objects that get altered will NOT be reflected in that entity's data "on the NET-Hook side" if that entity's data is being held in a NET-Hook Geometry object!
You can use to retrieve the result of the XForm operation.
If there was no 'selected' geometry found to be XForm'd, the return result will be 'true'.
Note that all 'selections' will be cleared by the XForm operation.
member.param: The scale origin point (in world coordinates).
The scaling factor.
true to copy, else false to move.
member.returns: true if it succeeds, false if it fails.

member.name: M:Mastercam.GeometryUtility.GeometryManipulationManager.MirrorGeometry(Mastercam.Math.Line3D,Mastercam.Database.MCView,System.Boolean)
member.summary: XForm-Mirror all of the 'selected' geometry entities.
member.remarks:
NOTE!
Any Geometry objects that get altered will NOT be reflected in that entity's data "on the NET-Hook side" if that entity's data is being held in a NET-Hook Geometry object!
You can use to retrieve the result of the XForm operation.
If the supplied view is null, the active Construction View will be used.
If there was no 'selected' geometry found to be XForm'd, the return result will be 'true'.
Note that all 'selections' will be cleared by the XForm operation.
member.param: The axis to mirror about.
The view.
true to copy, else false to move.
member.returns: true if it succeeds, false if it fails.

member.name: M:Mastercam.GeometryUtility.GeometryManipulationManager.RotateGeometry(Mastercam.Math.Point3D,System.Double,Mastercam.Database.MCView,System.Boolean)
member.summary: XForm-Rotate all of the 'selected' geometry entities.
member.param: The rotation origin point (in world coordinates).
The rotation angle.
The view.
true to copy, else false to move.
member.remarks:
NOTE!
Any Geometry objects that get altered will NOT be reflected in that entity's data "on the NET-Hook side" if that entity's data is being held in a NET-Hook Geometry object!
You can use to retrieve the result of the XForm operation.
If the View is null, the active Construction View will be used.
If there was no 'selected' geometry found to be XForm'd, the return result will be 'true'.
Note that all 'selections' will be cleared by the XForm operation.
member.returns: true if it succeeds, false if it fails.

member.name: M:Mastercam.GeometryUtility.GeometryManipulationManager.TranslateGeometry(Mastercam.Math.Point3D,Mastercam.Math.Point3D,Mastercam.Database.MCView,Mastercam.Database.MCView,System.Boolean)
member.summary: XForm-Translate all of the 'selected' geometry entities.
member.remarks:
NOTE!
Any Geometry objects that get altered will NOT be reflected in that entity's data "on the NET-Hook side" if that entity's data is being held in a NET-Hook Geometry object!
You can use to retrieve the result of the XForm operation.
If a supplied view is null, the active Construction View will be used.
If there was no 'selected' geometry found to be XForm'd, the return result will be 'true'.
Note that all 'selections' will be cleared by the XForm operation.
member.param: The 'from' point (in world coordinates).
The 'to' point (in world coordinates).
The 'from' view.
The 'to' view.
true to copy, else false to move.
member.returns: true if it succeeds, false if it fails.

This constructs a new torus solid object with default parameters.
The default parameters of a torus solid are for a full (360 degree) torus with the center at the WCS origin, (0.0, 0.0, 0.0), with a major radius of 0.5 and a minor radius of 0.25.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Support.UI.ModelessDialog.PostDialogResult(System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult)
member.summary: Posts a DialogResult message to the event queue.
member.remarks: You can then capture this "command" message in your GetEvent loop, allowing you to detect when the modeless dialog is closing, so that you can (optionally) end the GetEvent loop.
member.param: The type of DialogResult to be sent.
member.returns: true if it succeeds, false if it fails.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Support.GroupManager.NewGroup(System.String,Mastercam.Database.Types.ProductType,System.String)
member.summary: This method creates and returns a newly created Group object within the currently active group in Mastercam.
member.remarks:
This will create a Mill Machine Group using the default machine. Just as if you selected - Machine Type -> Mill -> Default in Mastercam.
If NewGroupName is null or an empty string, Mastercam will auto generate a name for the group. If you specify a name that is already used, the creation will fail.
member.param: The name of the new group being created.
The product type of the group to be created.
The (full path) name of the machine definition to use.
member.remarks:
If NewGroupName is null or an empty string, Mastercam will auto generate a name for the group. If you specify a name that is already used, the creation will fail.
If the specified Machine Definition file does not exist, the return will be a failure (a null return).
member.returns: The newly created group object, else null if failed.

member.param: The parent group the new group belongs to.
The name of the new group being created.
member.returns: The newly created group object, else null if failed.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.OperationsManager.CalcCycleTime(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates the cycle time of the selected operations.
member.remarks: Note that this assumes the operation is not in a 'dirty' state! This does not regenerate the operation if it is 'dirty', and the time returned will be 0.0 The time (in seconds) that's returned in the "raw" time of the operations. Any additional time (for tool changes, etc.) would need to be added to this if desired. You can use the functionality in the .NET Framework's TimeSpan to format the time as desired. See the related CalcCycleTime functionality in the Operation class.
member.param: True to process all operations. False to process just the selected operations.
member.returns: The calculated cycle time (in seconds).

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.OperationsManager.ClearBufferedOps
member.summary: This method clears the Toolpath Manager's deleted ops buffer.
member.remarks: Deleting an operation may not always completely clear that operation from the database, which can result in a file being marked as dirty and needing saving even though it may have already been saved. Clearing the deleted operations buffer can resolve this, but will also result in making the deletion of any operations non-undoable.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.OperationsManager.DoNesting(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This begins the nesting process in the current file.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Support.ExternalAppsManager.RunFTCommand(System.String)
member.summary: This method executes a run_FT_command to the Mastercam application.
member.remarks:
This allows for running many Mastercam commands via a Function Table command (string) as if the user had selected it via the UI.
Execution of the NET-Hook Add-In is paused until the called function returns.
See the Mastercam.FT file for available commands.
member.param: The command to be run.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Support.ExternalAppsManager.RunFTCommand(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method executes a run_FT_command to the specified application.
member.remarks:
This allows for running commands via a Function Table command (string) as if the user had selected it via the UI.
Execution of the NET-Hook Add-In is paused until the called function returns.
member.param: The name of the application to receive the command.
The command to be run.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Support.ExternalAppsManager.PostFTCommand(System.String)
member.summary: This method executes a post_FT_command to the Mastercam application.
member.remarks:
This allows for running many Mastercam commands via a Function Table command (string) as if the user had selected it via the UI.
This is a "fire and forget", which means that the NET-Hook Add-In does not pause execution and wait for the called function to complete.
See the Mastercam.FT file for available commands.
Some example commands:
OnPlanesTop
OnPlanesFront
OnPlanesBack
OnPlanesBottom
OnPlanesEqualsWcs
And many more...
member.param: The command to be run.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Support.ExternalAppsManager.PostFTCommand(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method executes a post_FT_command to the specified application.
member.remarks:
This allows for running commands via a Function Table command (string) as if the user had selected it via the UI.
This is a "fire and forget", which means that the NET-Hook Add-In does not pause execution and wait for the called function to complete.
member.param: The name of the application to receive the command.
The Function Table command to be run.

member.summary: Prepares the provided item using the settings in the specified machine group, and then adds the item to the specified machine group. If not suppressed, this function will warn the user of any similar items that already exist within the specified machine group. If the add is successful, the input parameter will updated to reflect adjusted slot number, tool number, tool offsets, and potentially station number.
member.param: The sp input.
Identifier for the machine group. A value of 'NULL_ID' will add the tool to the active machine group.
(Out) True if the user cancelled the operation.
(Optional) true to warning on similar tools.
(Optional) true to add if similar exists.
(Optional) true to initialize offsets.
(Optional) true to suppress tool number warning.
member.returns: true if it succeeds, false if it fails.

member.name: M:CWorkSheetTabControl.RestoreBookmark(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Restores a viewsheet's view settings to a previously saved bookmark of view settings.
member.remarks:
If it's the currenttly active viewsheet then it also updates the view.
Setting "forceViewUpdate" to true causes the graphics to be regenerated if the "in_file_get" global is false.
member.param: The index of the viewsheet to restore a bookmark on.
(Optional) true to force view update.

member.name: M:CWorkSheetTabControl.DeleteBookmark(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the bookmark for the specified viewsheet.
member.param: The index of the viewsheet to delete a bookmark on.

member.name: M:CWorkSheetTabControl.SaveBookmark(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method saves a view 'bookmark' for a specified viewsheet.
member.remarks: This allows the user to save off a copy of the the view settings at a given point, change the view, and then reload the old view settings from the bookmark.
member.param: The index of the viewsheet to save a bookmark on.

member.name: M:CWorkSheetTabControl.DeleteAllSheets
member.summary: Deletes all viewsheets.
member.remarks: This method deletes all of the viewsheet entry items from the internal array, empties the array, and then removes all of the tabs from the tab control. This REALLY needs to be followed up with a call to CreateNewSheet (), as this will leave the viewsheet control and array completely empty, and it's never supposed to be completely empty.

member.name: M:CWorkSheetTabControl.DeleteSheet(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes a viewsheet.
member.remarks: If it's the currently active tab, it then sets the first tab in the control as the currently active one and updates the view.
member.param: The index of the viewsheet to delete.
(Optional) True if deleting a temporary sheet.

member.name: M:CWorkSheetTabControl.UpdateView(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the view.
member.remarks:
This is where the magic happens! This member function takes a sheet's index, finds its entry in the viewsheet entries array, and updates the view with the appropriate settings. It also either repaints or rebuilds the graphics screen completely based on whether or not there have been any changes to the level information as a result of updating the view.
Note that setting "forceViewUpdate" to true causes the graphics to be regenerated if the "in_file_get" global is false.
member.param: The index of the sheet to update.
(Optional) True to force view update.

member.name: M:CWorkSheetTabControl.UpdateWorkSheets(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method updates the view, etc. depending on the state of the viewsheet tab control.
member.remarks:
If it's supposed to force a view update, then the view will be updated no matter what. If not, it will run some checks to determine if it thinks the view needs to be updated or not and act accordingly.
Setting "forceViewUpdate" to true causes the graphics to be regenerated if the "in_file_get" global is false.
member.param: True to force viewsheet update.

member.name: M:CWorkSheetTabControl.UpdateWorkSheets
member.summary: This method updates the view, etc. depending on the state of the viewsheet tab control.
member.remarks: It doesn't force a view update if it doesn't need to - for example, if the selected tab hasn't changed since the last view update then it won't update the view again. (Sort of like a repaint instead of a regen).

member.name: M:CWorkSheetTabControl.SaveCurrentSheetSettings(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method takes a snapshot of the current view settings and stores all of the information to the currently active viewsheet.
member.param: (Optional) true if check for changed.

member.name: T:CBCGPDialog
member.summary: The CBCGPDialog class extends the functionality of the CDialog class. It allows to define a background image or color for the dialog box window and handles all the palette an transparency issues. To take advantage of CBCGPDialog features you just need to derive your dialog class from the CBCGPDialog class instead of CDialog class. When you call SetBackgroundImage method and pass HBITMAP as the image handle, the CBCGPDialog object will take ownership over the image and delete it only if the m_bAutoDestroyBmp flag is TRUE. The current background image will be deleted if you call the SetBackgroundImage again or by OnDestroy message handler. Images loaded from the resource file are always destroyed automatically.

members.member: @enum UndoSpecialWhat * Defines possible values of what_happened in put_special_undo()
@par Purpose: Ends the undo transaction, removes it from the undo stack, and rolls back any changes that were made to the database during this transaction.

@par Purpose: Ends the undo transaction and keeps it on the undo stack. If the transaction was initiated by UndoSolidTransStart() the database changes will be maintained but the transaction will be removed from the undo stack.

@file DbUndo_CH.h * Unlimited Undo/Redo functions. * Unlimited Undo/Redo requires several new functions, some of which * replace old V9 functions. Some of the old V9 functions have been * retained but in most cases they do something slightly different. * Please refer to "Unlimited Undo-Redo API.doc" for more detailed * documentation on the use of these functions.
@par Purpose: Starts a new undo transaction. The transaction is completed by calling UndoTransCommit() or UndoTransTerminate(). @return true if the Undo Transaction was started successfully
@par Purpose Set whether or not "SaveSome" is to be the current state of "File/Save"
@par Purpose * Mark the database as having changed. See has_db_changed
@par Purpose * Set an internal variable indicating that the database has not been modified

member.summary: Helper function for overloaded Open functions that actually does the open.
member.param: Fully qualified file name to open.
Type of access permitted.
Type of sharing allowed.
member.remarks: Refer to help for _tfsopen for possible values for mode and shFlag. shFlag is optional and defaults to _SH_DENYNO.
member.returns: Returns true if the file opened successfully or if the same file name is already open. Returns false if a different file is currently open or if the open fails.

member.name: M:MCFileBase.Initialize(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes member variables to default values.
member.remarks: A constructor must pass true for "constructor" to prevent the virtual function "CurrentVersion" from being called (to get the major and minor version numbers). When "constructor" is true, both m_VersionMajor and m_VersionMinor are set to zero.
member.param: Optional flag to indicate we are called from a constructor.

member.name: M:MCFileBase.SetMastercamFileType(MCFileType)
member.summary: Sets the type of the currently open file.
member.remarks: Currently this is not set automatically by this class nor is it saved in the file. The application accessing the file must set it using this function.
Initialized at file open to MCFT_UNDEF.

member.name: M:MCFileBase.GetSaveAsVersion
member.summary: Gets the major version number that the file will be saved as.
member.remarks: This value will be 0 for the current version. By default the file will be saved as the current version. If the file is to be saved as a previous version the the application will need to set this using SetSaveAsVersion.

member.name: M:MCFileBase.GetFileVersionMajor
member.summary: Gets the major version number of the currently open file.

member.summary: Gets the type of the currently open file.

member.name: M:MCFileBase.GetFullName
member.summary: Gets the fully qualified name of the currently open file.
member.remarks: If file is not open, a empty string will be returned.

member.name: M:MCFileBase.IsStandardOutput
member.summary: Returns true if the stream is directed to standard output.

member.name: M:MCFileBase.Is32BitFile
member.summary: Returns true if the file being read was saved by a 32 bit version of Mastercam.

member.name: M:MCFileBase.IsImportExportFile

member.name: M:MCFileBase.IsEducationalFile
member.summary: Returns true if the file being read is an Educational file.

member.name: M:MCFileBase.Rewind(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value of the file pointer to the beginning of the file
member.param: if true, even EMCX files will position to zero.
member.remarks: For Educational files, the position will actually be set to the first position after the encrypted header, unless the override parameter is passed.
member.returns: True if successful, false if file not open.

member.name: M:MCFileBase.SetPosition(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the file pointer to a specified location.
member.param: Number of bytes from origin.
Initial position.
member.remarks: Refer to help for fseeki64 for possible values for origin. This function is designed to handle files greater than 2GB in length, but it also works with a long parameter for files less than 2GB. For Educational files, if the seek would result in positioning to the beginning of the file, the position will actually be set to the first position after the encrypted header.
member.returns: Returns 0 if successful, otherwise returns a nonzero value.

member.summary: Opens the specified fileName using the read/write mode and the shFlag (sharing) option.
member.param: Fully qualified file name to open.
Type of access permitted.
Type of sharing allowed.
member.remarks: Refer to help for _tfsopen for possible values for mode and shFlag. shFlag is optional and defaults to _SH_DENYNO.
member.returns: Returns true if the file opened successfully or if the same file name is already open. Returns false if a different file is currently open or if the open fails.

member.summary: Opens the specified fileName in filePath using the read/write mode and the shFlag (sharing) option.
member.param: Path where fileName is located.
File name to open in filePath.
Type of access permitted.
Type of sharing allowed.
member.remarks: Refer to help for _tfsopen for possible values for mode and shFlag. shFlag is optional and defaults to _SH_DENYNO.
member.returns: Returns true if the file opened successfully or if the same file name is already open. Returns false if a different file is currently open or if the open fails.

member.name: M:Cnc.Tool.TlMgr.Find(System.Int32!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsLong!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced,std.shared_ptr<Cnc.Tool.TlToolLathe>*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced)
member.summary: Searches for an item in the tool manager. If an item with the provided ID is found, and it castable to the TYPE of the item parameter, the function copies the data from the tool manager into the provided item reference. In addition, if a matching ID/TYPE is not found, the tool manager will search for an assembly that matches the ID, and return the main tool if the item TYPE is castable into a TlTool, or the main holder if the item TYPE is castable into a TlHolder.
member.param: The slot.
The tool.
member.returns: true if the item is found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Cnc.Tool.TlMgr.Find(System.Int32!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsLong!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced,std.shared_ptr<Cnc.Tool.TlAssembly>*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced)
member.summary: Searches for an item in the tool manager. If an item with the provided ID is found, and it castable to the TYPE of the item parameter, the function copies the data from the tool manager into the provided item reference. In addition, if a matching ID/TYPE is not found, the tool manager will search for an assembly that matches the ID, and return the main tool if the item TYPE is castable into a TlTool, or the main holder if the item TYPE is castable into a TlHolder.
member.param: The slot.

members.member: @par Purpose: This is the default TpOpMgr destructor. It empties all of the list stacks upon destruction.
@par Purpose: This is the default TpOpMgr constructor. It initializes the list stacks upon creation.
This is the manager class's main operation list stack. This is where instances of our main operation lists get stored.

@par Purpose: This class's purpose is to hold and work with instances of the op manager operation list classes for the life of a given Mastercam app execution. It also houses the operation list stacks themselves, which we use to manage temporary list creation situations (see base TpMgr class declaration for more details).

members.member: @par Purpose: This is the default TpMatMgr destructor. It empties all of the list stacks upon destruction.
@par Purpose: This is the default TpMatMgr constructor. It initializes the list stacks upon creation.
This is the manager class's main material list stack. This is where instances of our main material lists get stored.

@par Purpose: This class's purpose is to hold and work with instances of the op manager material list classes for the life of a given Mastercam app execution. It also houses the material list stacks themselves, which we use to manage temporary list creation situations (see base TpMgr class declaration for more details).
List Return Code types
@par Purpose: This is the basic TpMgr constructor. Note that the stack depth initializes to zero.
This is a running tally of how many lists are on the stacks at any given time.

@par Purpose: This class's purpose is to set up an interface for the managing of Mastercam's internal Op Manager lists. The list objects are managed in stacks, which gives Mastercam some flexibility when it has to create new 'main' lists for temporary purposes (temporary databases, file I/O, etc.). In those situations, the list stacks allow us to push new, temporary list objects onto the stacks for use during the duration of the temporary situation. Once no longer needed, we can then pop those temporary lists off the stacks and still be left with our original lists still completely intact. This architecture removes the need to swap memory in and out for temporary lists and still easily accomodates nested temporary list creation situations.

member.summary: Moves the file pointer to a specified location.

Initial position.
member.remarks: Refer to help for fseeki64 for possible values for origin. This function is designed to handle files greater than 2GB in length, but it also works with a long parameter for files less than 2GB. For Educational files, if the seek would result in positioning to the beginning of the file, the position will actually be set to the first position after the encrypted header.

Component group parameters @brief Component group parameters
A linked list of these parameters is stored with a component group. This allows a group to have the parameters of more than one group type. For example, a component group can have both turret and spindle parameters. The turret and spindle specific parameters are stored in different entries in the list

member.name: T:CONE_sf
member.summary: Cone definition structure that corresponds to Parasolid's cone structure.
member.remarks: To convert to Mastercam units one simply uses mastercamValue = PS2MC (parasolidValue) for a value like the radius, or PS2MCPT3D (parasolidPoint, mastercamPoint) for point values. No conversion is required for unit vectors like the axis and ref_direction or for an angular value.

member.name: T:CYLINDER_sf
member.summary: Cylinder definition structure that corresponds to Parasolid's cylinder structure.
member.remarks: To convert to Mastercam units one simply uses mastercamValue = PS2MC (parasolidValue) for a value like the radius, or PS2MCPT3D (parasolidPoint, mastercamPoint) for point values. No conversion is required for unit vectors like the axis and ref_direction or for an angular value.

member.name: M:CRenderTarget.PopAxisAlignedClip
member.summary: Removes the last axis-aligned clip from the render target. After this method is called, the clip is no longer applied to subsequent drawing operations.

member.name: M:CRenderTarget.PushAxisAlignedClip(CD2DRectF!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced,D2D1_ANTIALIAS_MODE)
member.summary: Removes the last axis-aligned clip from the render target. After this method is called, the clip is no longer applied to subsequent drawing operations.
member.param: The size and position of the clipping area, in device-independent pixels.

The antialiasing mode that is used to draw the edges of clip rects that have subpixel boundaries, and to blend the clip with the scene contents. The blending is performed once when the PopAxisAlignedClip method is called, and does not apply to each primitive within the layer.

member.name: M:CRenderTarget.CreateCompatibleRenderTarget(CBitmapRenderTarget*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced,CD2DSizeF,CD2DSizeU,D2D1_PIXEL_FORMAT*,D2D1_COMPATIBLE_RENDER_TARGET_OPTIONS)
member.summary: Creates a new bitmap render target for use during intermediate offscreen drawing that is compatible with the current render target .
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns TRUE. Otherwise, it returns FALSE.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to a new bitmap render target. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
The desired size of the new render target in device-independent pixels if it should be different from the original render target, or NULL. For more information, see the Remarks section.
The desired size of the new render target in pixels if it should be different from the original render target, or NULL. For more information, see the Remarks section.

The desired pixel format and alpha mode of the new render target, or NULL. If the pixel format is set to DXGI_FORMAT_UNKNOWN or if this parameter is null, the new render target uses the same pixel format as the original render target. If the alpha mode is D2D1_ALPHA_MODE_UNKNOWN or this parameter is NULL, the alpha mode of the new render target defaults to D2D1_ALPHA_MODE_PREMULTIPLIED. For information about supported pixel formats, see Supported Pixel Formats and Alpha Modes.
A value that specifies whether the new render target must be compatible with GDI.

When this method returns, contains the bounds of the widened geometry. You must allocate storage for this parameter.
The maximum bounds on the distance between points in the polygonal approximation of the geometries. Smaller values produce more accurate results but cause slower execution.

member.name: M:CD2DGeometry.GetBounds(D2D_MATRIX_3X2_F!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced,CD2DRectF*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced)
member.summary: Retrieves the bounds of the geometry.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns TRUE. Otherwise, it returns FALSE.
member.param: The transform to apply to this geometry before calculating its bounds.

When this method returns, contains the bounds of this geometry. If the bounds are empty, this will be a rect where bounds.left is greater than bounds.right. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

member.summary: Calculates the point and tangent vector at the specified distance along the geometry after it has been transformed by the specified matrix and flattened using the specified tolerance.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns TRUE. Otherwise, it returns FALSE.
member.param: The distance along the geometry of the point and tangent to find. If this distance is less then 0, this method calculates the first point in the geometry. If this distance is greater than the length of the geometry, this method calculates the last point in the geometry.
The transform to apply to the geometry before calculating the specified point and tangent.
The location at the specified distance along the geometry. If the geometry is empty, this point contains NaN as its x and y values.

When this method returns, contains a pointer to the tangent vector at the specified distance along the geometry. If the geometry is empty, this vector contains NaN as its x and y values. You must allocate storage for this parameter.
The maximum bounds on the distance between points in the polygonal approximation of the geometry. Smaller values produce more accurate results but cause slower execution.

member.summary: Calculates the length of the geometry as though each segment were unrolled into a line.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns TRUE. Otherwise, it returns FALSE.
member.param: The transform to apply to the geometry before calculating its length.
When this method returns, contains a pointer to the length of the geometry. For closed geometries, the length includes an implicit closing segment. You must allocate storage for this parameter.
The maximum bounds on the distance between points in the polygonal approximation of the geometry. Smaller values produce more accurate results but cause slower execution.

member.name: M:CCustomTransition.Create(IUIAnimationTransitionLibrary*,IUIAnimationTransitionFactory*)
member.summary: Calls the transition library to create encapsulated transition COM object.
member.remarks: This method also can set initial value and initial velocity to be applied to an animation variable, which is associated with this transition. For this purpose you have to call SetInitialValue and SetInitialVelocity before the framework creates the encapsulated transition COM object (it happens when you call CAnimationController::AnimateGroup).
member.param: A pointer to transition library, which is responsible for creation of standard transitions.
A pointer to transition factory, which is responsible for creation of custom transitions.

member.summary: Sets an initial velocity, which will be applied to an animation variable associated with this transition.

member.summary: Sets an initial value, which will be applied to an animation variable associated with this transition.

member.name: F:CCustomTransition.m_pInterpolator
member.summary: Stores a pointer to a custom interpolator.

member.name: T:CCustomTransition
member.summary: Implements custom transition.
member.remarks: The CCustomTransitions class allows developers to implement custom transitions. It's created and used as a standard transition, but its constructor accepts as parameter a pointer to a custom interpolator. Perform the following steps to use custom transitions: 1. Derive a class from CCustomInterpolator and implement at least InterpolateValue method. 2. Ensure that the lifetime of custom interpolator object must be longer than duration of animation where it's used. 3. Instantiate (using operator new) a CCustomTransition object and pass a pointer to custom interpolator in the constructor. 4. Call CCustomTransition::SetInitialValue and CCustomTransition::SetInitialVelocity if these parameters are required for custom interpolation. 5. Pass the pointer to custom transition to AddTransition method of animation object, whose value should be animated with the custom algorithm. 6. When the value of animation object should change Windows Animation API will call InterpolateValue (and other relevant methods) in CCustomInterpolator.

member.name: T:CSinusoidalTransitionFromVelocity
member.summary: Encapsulates a sinusoidal-velocity transition, with an amplitude determined by the animation variable's initial velocity..
member.remarks: The value of the animation variable oscillates around the initial value over the entire duration of a sinusoidal-range transition. The amplitude of the oscillation is determined by the animation variable's velocity when the transition begins. Because all transitions are cleared automatically, it's recommended to allocated them using operator new. The encapsulated IUIAnimationTransition COM object is created by CAnimationController::AnimateGroup, until then it's NULL. Changing member variables after creation of this COM object has no effect.

member.name: T:CSinusoidalTransitionFromRange
member.summary: Encapsulates a sinusoidal-range transition, with a given range of oscillation.
member.remarks: The value of the animation variable fluctuates between the specified minimum and maximum values over the entire duration of a sinusoidal-range transition. The slope parameter is used to disambiguate between the two possible sine waves specified by the other parameters. Because all transitions are cleared automatically, it's recommended to allocated them using operator new. The encapsulated IUIAnimationTransition COM object is created by CAnimationController::AnimateGroup, until then it's NULL. Changing member variables after creation of this COM object has no effect.

The final value will be the same as the initial value and the final velocity will be the negative of the initial velocity. Because all transitions are cleared automatically, it's recommended to allocated them using operator new. The encapsulated IUIAnimationTransition COM object is created by CAnimationController::AnimateGroup, until then it's NULL. Changing member variables after creation of this COM object has no effect.

You can control how quickly the variable reaches the final value by specifying the rate of acceleration. Because all transitions are cleared automatically, it's recommended to allocated them using operator new. The encapsulated IUIAnimationTransition COM object is created by CAnimationController::AnimateGroup, until then it's NULL. Changing member variables after creation of this COM object has no effect.

member.name: T:CSmoothStopTransition
member.summary: Encapsulates a smooth-stop transition.
member.remarks: A smooth-stop transition slows down as it approaches a given final value, and reaches it with a velocity of zero. The duration of the transition is determined by the initial velocity, the difference between the initial and final values, and the specified maximum duration. If there is no solution consisting of a single parabolic arc, this method creates a cubic transition. Because all transitions are cleared automatically, it's recommended to allocated them using operator new. The encapsulated IUIAnimationTransition COM object is created by CAnimationController::AnimateGroup, until then it's NULL. Changing member variables after creation of this COM object has no effect.

member.name: T:CAccelerateDecelerateTransition
member.summary: Implements an accelerate-decelerate transition.
member.remarks: During an accelerate-decelerate transition, the animation variable speeds up and then slows down over the duration of the transition, ending at a specified value. You can control how quickly the variable accelerates and decelerates independently, by specifying different acceleration and deceleration ratios. When the initial velocity is zero, the acceleration ratio is the fraction of the duration that the variable will spend accelerating; likewise with the deceleration ratio. If the initial velocity is non-zero, it is the fraction of the time between the velocity reaching zero and the end of transition. The acceleration ratio and the deceleration ratio should sum to a maximum of 1.0. Because all transitions are cleared automatically, it's recommended to allocated them using operator new. The encapsulated IUIAnimationTransition COM object is created by CAnimationController::AnimateGroup, until then it's NULL. Changing member variables after creation of this COM object has no effect.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.OnAfterSchedule(CAnimationGroup*)
member.summary: Called by the framework when an animation for the specified group has just been scheduled.
member.remarks: The default implementation removes keyframes from the specified group and transitions from animation variables that belong to the specified group. Can be overridden in a derived class to take any additional actions upon animation schedule.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.OnAnimationTimerRenderingTooSlow(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Called by the framework when the rendering frame rate for an animation falls below a minimum desirable frame rate.
member.remarks: This method is called if you enable timer event handlers using EnableAnimationTimerEventHandler. It can be overridden in a derived class to take application-specific actions. The minimum desirable frame rate is specified by calling IUIAnimationTimer::SetFrameRateThreshold.
member.param: The current frame rate in frames per second.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.OnAnimationTimerPostUpdate
member.summary: Called by the framework after an animation update is finished.
member.remarks: This method is called if you enable timer event handlers using EnableAnimationTimerEventHandler. It can be overridden in a derived class to take application-specific actions.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.OnAnimationTimerPreUpdate
member.summary: Called by the framework before an animation update begins.
member.remarks: This method is called if you enable timer event handlers using EnableAnimationTimerEventHandler. It can be overridden in a derived class to take application-specific actions.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.OnHasPriorityCompress(CAnimationGroup*,CAnimationGroup*,__MIDL___MIDL_itf_UIAnimation_0000_0008_0001)
member.summary: Called by the framework to resolve scheduling conflicts.
member.returns: Should return TRUE if storyboard owned by pGroupNew has priority. Should return FALSE if storyboard owned by pGroupScheduled has priority.
member.remarks: This method is called if you enable priority comparison events using CAnimationController::EnablePriorityComparisonHandler and specify UI_ANIMATION_PHT_COMPRESS. It can be overridden in a derived class to take application-specific actions. Read Windows Animation API documentation for more information about Conflict Management (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd371759(VS.85).aspx).
member.param: The group that owns the currently scheduled storyboard.
The group that owns the new storyboard that is in scheduling conflict with the scheduled storyboard owned by pGroupScheduled.
The potential effect on pGroupNew if pGroupScheduled has a higher priority.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.OnBeforeAnimationStart(CAnimationGroup*)
member.summary: Called by the framework right before the animation is scheduled.
member.remarks: This call is routed to related CWnd and can be overridden in a derived class to perform any additional actions before the animation starts for the specified group.
member.param: A pointer to an animation group whose animation is about to start.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.CleanUpGroup(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Called by the framework to clean up the group when animation has been scheduled.
member.remarks: This method removes all transitions and keyframes from the specified group, because they are not relevant after an animation has been scheduled.
member.param: Specifies GroupID.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.ScheduleGroup(System.UInt32,System.Double)
member.summary: Schedules an animation.
member.returns: TRUE if animation was scheduled successfully. FALSE if storyboard has not been created, or other error occurs.
member.remarks: You must call AnimateGroup with parameter bScheduleNow set to FALSE prior ScheduleGroup. You can specify the desired animation time obtained from IUIAnimationTimer::GetTime. If the time parameter is 0.0, the animation is scheduled for the current time.
member.param: Specifies animation Group ID to schedule.
Specifies time to schedule.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.AnimateGroup(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Prepares a group to run animation and optionally schedules it.
member.returns: TRUE if animation was successfully scheduled and run.
member.remarks: This method does the actual work creating storyboard, adding animation variables, applying transitions and setting keyframes. It's possible to delay scheduling if you set bScheduleNow to FALSE. In this case the specified group will hold a storyboard that has been set up for animation. At that point you can setup events for the storyboard and animation variables. When you actually need to run the animation call CAnimationController::ScheduleGroup.
member.param: Specifies GroupID.
Specifies whether to run animation right away.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.FindAnimationObject(IUIAnimationVariable*,CAnimationBaseObject**,CAnimationGroup**)
member.summary: Finds animation object containing a specified animation variable.
member.returns: TRUE if object was found; otherwise FALSE.
member.remarks: Called from event handlers when it's required to find an animation object from incoming animation variable.
member.param: A pointer to animation variable.
Output. Contains a pointer to animation object or NULL.
Output. Contains a pointer to animation group that holds the animation object, or NULL.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.FindAnimationGroup(IUIAnimationStoryboard*)
member.summary: Finds an animation group by its storyboard.
member.returns: A pointer to animation group if succeeds, or NULL if no group plays the specified storyboard.
member.remarks: This method is usually called from event handlers to find a group by pointer to storyboard that comes as a parameter to an event handler.
member.param: A pointer to a storyboard.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.FindAnimationGroup(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Finds an animation group by its Group ID.
member.returns: A pointer to animation group or NULL if the group with specified ID is not found.
member.remarks: Use this method to find an animation group at runtime. A group is created and added to the internal list of animation groups when a first animation object with particular GroupID is being added to animation controller.
member.param: Specifies a GroupID.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.AddKeyframeToGroup(System.UInt32,CBaseKeyFrame*)
member.summary: Adds a keyframe to group.
member.returns: TRUE if the function succeeds; otherwise FALSE.
member.remarks: Usually you don't need to call this method, use CAnimationController::CreateKeyframe instead, which creates and adds the created keyframe to a group automatically.
member.param: Specifies Group ID.
A pointer to a keyframe.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.CreateKeyframe(System.UInt32,CBaseKeyFrame*,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a keyframe that depends on other keyframe with optional offset in seconds and adds it to the specified group.
member.returns: A pointer to newly created keyframe if the function succeeds.
member.remarks: You can store the returned pointer and base other keyframes on the newly created keyframe (see the second overload). It's possible to begin transitions at keyframes - see CBaseTransition::SetKeyframes. You don't need to delete keyframes created in this way, because they are deleted automatically by animation groups. Be careful when creating keyframes based on other keyframes and transitions and avoid circular references.
member.param: Specifies Group ID for which keyframe is created.
A pointer to base keyframe for this keyframe.
Offset in seconds from the base keyframe specified by pKeyframe.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.CreateKeyframe(System.UInt32,CBaseTransition*)
member.summary: Creates a keyframe that depends on transition and adds it to the specified group.
member.returns: A pointer to newly created keyframe if the function succeeds.
member.remarks: You can store the returned pointer and base other keyframes on the newly created keyframe (see the second overload). It's possible to begin transitions at keyframes - see CBaseTransition::SetKeyframes. You don't need to delete keyframes created in this way, because they are deleted automatically by animation groups. Be careful when creating keyframes based on other keyframes and transitions and avoid circular references.
member.param: Specifies Group ID for which keyframe is created.
A pointer to transition. Keyframe will be inserted to storyboard after this transition.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.RemoveTransitions(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Removes transitions from animation objects that belong to the specified group.
member.remarks: The group loops over its animation objects and calls ClearTransitions(FALSE) for each animation object. This method is called by the framework after animation has been scheduled.
member.param: Specifies Group ID.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.RemoveAllAnimationGroups
member.summary: Removes all animation groups from animation controller.
member.remarks: All groups will be deleted, their pointer, if stored at the application level, must be invalidated. If CAnimationGroup::m_bAutodestroyAnimationObjects for a group being deleted is TRUE, all animation objects that belong to that group will be deleted; otherwise their references to parent animation controller will be set to NULL and they can be added to another controller.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.RemoveAnimationGroup(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Removes an animation group with specified ID from animation controller.
member.remarks: This method removes an animation group from the internal list of groups and deletes it, therefore if you stored a pointer to that animation group, it must be invalidated. If CAnimationGroup::m_bAutodestroyAnimationObjects is TRUE, all animation objects that belong to that group will be deleted; otherwise their references to parent animation controller will be set to NULL and they can be added to another controller.
member.param: Specifies animation group ID.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.RemoveAnimationObject(CAnimationBaseObject*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove an animation object from animation controller.
member.remarks: Removes an animation object from animation controller and animation group. Call this function if a particular object should not be animated anymore, or if you need to move the object to another animation controller. In the last case bNoDelete must be TRUE.
member.param: A pointer to an animation object.
If this parameter is TRUE the object will not be deleted upon remove.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.AddAnimationObject(CAnimationBaseObject*)
member.summary: Adds an animation object to a group that belongs to the animation controller.
member.returns: A pointer to existing or new animation group where pObject has been added if function succeeds; NULL if pObject has already been added to a group that belongs to another animation controller.
member.remarks: Call this method to add an animation object to the animation controller. An object will be added to a group according to object's GroupID (see CAnimationBaseObject::SetID). The animation controller will create a new group if it's the first object being added with the specified GroupID. An animation object can be added to one animation controller only. If you need to add an object to another controller, call RemoveAnimationObject first. If you call SetID with new GroupID for an object that has been already added to a group, the object will be removed from the old group and added to another group with specified ID.
member.param: A pointer to an animation object.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.SetRelatedWnd(CWnd*)
member.summary: Establishes a relationship between animation controller and a window.
member.remarks: If a related CWnd object is set, the animation controller can automatically update it (send WM_PAINT message) when the status of animation manager has changed or timer post update event has occurred.
member.param: A pointer to window object to set.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.IsAnimationInProgress
member.summary: Tells whether at least one group is playing animation.
member.returns: TRUE if there is an animation in progress for this animation controller; otherwise FALSE.
member.remarks: Checks status of animation manager and returns TRUE if the status is UI_ANIMATION_MANAGER_BUSY.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.UpdateAnimationManager
member.summary: Directs the animation manager to update the values of all animation variables.
member.remarks: Calling this method advances the animation manager to current time, changing statuses of storyboards as necessary and updating any animation variables to appropriate interpolated values. Internally this method calls IUIAnimationTimer::GetTime(timeNow) and IUIAnimationManager::Update(timeNow). Override this method in a derived class to customize this behavior.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.EnableAnimationTimerEventHandler(System.Int32,__MIDL___MIDL_itf_UIAnimation_0000_0012_0001)
member.summary: Sets or releases a handler for timing events and handler for timing updates.
member.returns: TRUE if handlers were successfully set or released; FALSE if this method is called for a second time without releasing the handlers first, or if any other error occurs.
member.remarks: When the handlers are set (enabled) Windows Animation API calls OnAnimationTimerPreUpdate, OnAnimationTimerPostUpdate, OnRenderingTooSlow methods. You need to enable animation timers to allow Windows Animation API update storyboards. Otherwise you'll need to call CAnimationController::UpdateAnimationManager in order to direct the animation manager to update the values of all animation variables.
member.param: Specifies whether to set or release the handlers.
Specifies idle behavior for timer update handler.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.EnableStoryboardEventHandler(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets or releases a handler for storyboard status and update events.
member.returns: TRUE if the handler was successfully set or released; FALSE if the specified animation group is now found or animation for the specified group has not been initiated and its internal storyboard is NULL.
member.remarks: When a handler is set (enabled) Windows Animation API calls OnStoryboardStatusChanges and OnStoryboardUpdated virtual methods. A handler must be set after CAnimationController::Animate has been called for the specified animation group, because it creates encapsulated IUIAnimationStoryboard object.
member.param: Specifies Group ID.
Specifies whether to set or release a handler.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.EnablePriorityComparisonHandler(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Sets or releases the priority comparison handler to call to determine whether a scheduled storyboard can be cancelled, concluded, trimmed or compressed.
member.returns: TRUE if the handler was successfully set or released.
member.remarks: When a handler is set (enabled) Windows Animation calls the following virtual methods depending on dwHandlerType: OnHasPriorityCancel, OnHasPriorityConclude, OnHasPriorityTrim, OnHasPriorityCompress. dwHandler can be a combination of the following flags: UI_ANIMATION_PHT_NONE - release all handlers UI_ANIMATION_PHT_CANCEL - set Cancel comparison handler UI_ANIMATION_PHT_CONCLUDE - set Conclude comparison handler UI_ANIMATION_PHT_COMPRESS - set Compress comparison handler UI_ANIMATION_PHT_TRIM - set Trim comparison handler UI_ANIMATION_PHT_CANCEL_REMOVE - remove Cancel comparison handler UI_ANIMATION_PHT_CONCLUDE_REMOVE - remove Conclude comparison handler UI_ANIMATION_PHT_COMPRESS_REMOVE - remove Compress comparison handler UI_ANIMATION_PHT_TRIM_REMOVE - remove Trim comparison handler
member.param: A combination of UI_ANIMATION_PHT_ flags (see remarks), which specifies what handlers to set or release.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.EnableAnimationManagerEvent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets or releases a handler to call when animation manager's status changes.
member.returns: TRUE if the handler was successfully set or released.
member.remarks: When a handler is set (enabled) Windows Animation calls OnAnimationManagerStatusChanged when animation manager's status changes.
member.param: Specifies whether to set or release a handler.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.GetKeyframeStoryboardStart
member.summary: Returns a keyframe that identifies start of storyboard.
member.returns: A pointer to base keyframe, which identifies start of storyboard.
member.remarks: Obtain this keyframe to base any other keyframes or transitions on the moment in time when a storyboard starts.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.IsValid
member.summary: Tells whether animation controller is valid.
member.returns: TRUE if animation controller is valid; otherwise FALSE.
member.remarks: This method returns FALSE only if Windows Animation API is not supported on the current OS and creation of animation manager failed because it's not registered. You need to call GetUIAnimationManager at least once after initialization of COM libraries to cause setting of this flag.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.GetUITransitionFactory
member.summary: A pointer to IUIAnimationTransitionFactory interface or NULL, if creation of transition library failed.
member.returns: A pointer to IUIAnimationTransitionFactory or NULL, if creation of transition factory failed.
member.remarks: If current OS does not support Windows Animation API, this method returns NULL and after that all subsequent calls on CAnimationController::IsValid return FALSE.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.GetUIAnimationTimer
member.summary: Provides access to encapsulated IUIAnimationTimer object.
member.returns: A pointer to IUIAnimationTimer interface or NULL, if creation of animation timer failed.
member.remarks: If current OS does not support Windows Animation API, this method returns NULL and after that all subsequent calls on CAnimationController::IsValid return FALSE.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.GetUITransitionLibrary
member.summary: Provides access to encapsulated IUIAnimationTransitionLibrary object.
member.returns: A pointer to IUIAnimationTransitionLibrary interface or NULL, if creation of transition library failed.
member.remarks: If current OS does not support Windows Animation API, this method returns NULL and after that all subsequent calls on CAnimationController::IsValid return FALSE.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.GetUIAnimationManager
member.summary: Provides access to encapsulated IUIAnimationManager object.
member.returns: A pointer to IUIAnimationManager interface or NULL, if creation of animation manager failed.
member.remarks: If current OS does not support Windows Animation API, this method returns NULL and after that all subsequent calls on CAnimationController::IsValid return FALSE. You may need to access IUIAnimationManager in order to call its interface methods, which are not wrapped by animation controller.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.Dispose
member.summary: The destructor. Called when animation controller object is being destroyed.

member.name: M:CAnimationController.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an animation controller.

member.name: F:CAnimationController.g_KeyframeStoryboardStart
member.summary: A keyframe that represents start of storyboard.

member.name: F:CAnimationController.m_lstAnimationGroups
member.summary: A list of animation groups that belong to this animation controller.

member.name: F:CAnimationController.m_pRelatedWnd
member.summary: A pointer to a related CWnd object, which can be automatically redrawn when the status of animation manager has changed, or post update event has occurred. Can be NULL.

member.name: F:CAnimationController.m_pTransitionFactory
member.summary: Stores a pointer to Transition Factory COM object.

member.name: F:CAnimationController.m_pAnimationTimer
member.summary: Stores a pointer to Animation Timer COM object.

member.name: F:CAnimationController.m_pTransitionLibrary
member.summary: Stores a pointer to Transition Library COM object.

member.name: F:CAnimationController.m_pAnimationManager
member.summary: Stores a pointer to Animation Manager COM object.

member.name: F:CAnimationController.m_bIsValid
member.summary: Specifies whether an animation controller is valid or not. This member is set to FALSE if current OS does not support Windows Animation API.

member.name: T:CAnimationController
member.summary: Implements the animation controller, which provides a central interface for creating and managing UI animations.
member.remarks: The CAnimationController class is the key class that manages animations. You may create one or more instances of animation controller in an application and, optionally, connect an instance of animation controller to a CWnd object using CAnimationController::SetRelatedWnd. This connection is required to send WM_PAINT messages to the related window automatically when animation manager status has changed or animation timer has been updated. If you do not enable this relation, you must redraw a window that displays an animation manually. For this purpose you can derive a class from CAnimationController and override OnAnimationManagerStatusChanged and/or OnAnimationTimerPostUpdate and invalidate one or more windows when necessary.

member.name: F:CAnimationGroup.m_bAutodestroyAnimationObjects
member.summary: Specifies how to destroy animation objects. If this parameter is TRUE, animation objects will be destroyed automatically when the group is destroyed. Otherwise animation objects must be destroyed manually. The default value is FALSE. Set this value to TRUE only if all animation objects that belong to group are allocated dynamically with operator new.

member.name: F:CAnimationGroup.m_bAutoclearTransitions
member.summary: Specifies how to clear transitions from animation objects that belong to group. If this member is TRUE, transitions are removed automatically when an animation has been scheduled. Otherwise you need to remove transitions manually.

member.name: F:CAnimationGroup.m_bAutodestroyKeyframes
member.summary: Specifies how to destroy keyframes. If this value is TRUE, all keyframes are removed and destroyed; otherwise they are removed from the list only. The default value is TRUE.

member.name: F:CAnimationGroup.m_pStoryboard
member.summary: Points to animation storyboard. This pointer is valid only after call on Animate.

member.name: F:CAnimationGroup.m_lstKeyFrames
member.summary: Contains a list of keyframes.

member.name: F:CAnimationGroup.m_lstAnimationObjects
member.summary: Contains a list of animation objects.

member.name: M:CAnimationGroup.SetAutodestroyTransitions(System.Int32)
member.summary: Directs all animation objects that belong to group automatically destroy transitions.
member.remarks: Set this value to FALSE only if you allocate transitions on the stack. The default value is TRUE, therefore it's highly recommended to allocate transition objects using operator new.
member.param: Specifies how to destroy transitions.

member.name: M:CAnimationGroup.Schedule(IUIAnimationTimer*,System.Double)
member.summary: Schedules an animation at the specified time.
member.returns: TRUE if the method succeeds; FALSE if the method fails or if Animate has not been called with bScheduleNow set to FALSE.
member.remarks: Call this function to schedule an animation at the specified time. You must call Animate with bScheduleNow set to FALSE first.
member.param: A pointer to animation timer.
Specifies time to schedule the animation.

member.name: M:CAnimationGroup.Animate(IUIAnimationManager*,IUIAnimationTimer*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Animates a group.
member.returns: TRUE if the method succeeds; otherwise FALSE.
member.remarks: This method creates an internal storyboard, creates and applies transitions and schedules an animation if bScheduleNow is TRUE. If bScheduleNow is FALSE, you need to call Schedule to start animation at the specified time.

member.name: M:CAnimationGroup.FindAnimationObject(IUIAnimationVariable*)
member.summary: Finds an animation object that contains the specified animation variable.
member.returns: A pointer to animation object, or NULL if animation object is not found.
member.param: A pointer to animation variable.

member.name: M:CAnimationGroup.RemoveKeyframes
member.summary: Removes and optionally destroys all keyframes that belong to an animation group.
member.remarks: If m_bAutodestroyKeyframes member is TRUE then keyframes are removed and destroyed, otherwise keyframes are just removed from the internal list of keyframes.

member.name: M:CAnimationGroup.RemoveTransitions
member.summary: Removes transitions from animation objects that belong to an animation group.
member.remarks: If m_bAutoclearTransitions flag is set to TRUE, this method loops over all animation objects that belong to the group and calls CAnimationObject::ClearTransitions(FALSE).

member.name: M:CAnimationGroup.ApplyTransitions
member.summary: Applies transitions to animation objects.
member.remarks: This method ASSERTS in debug mode if storyboard has not been created. It creates all transitions first, then adds "static" keyframes (keyframes that depend on offsets), adds transitions that do not depend on keyframes, adds keyframes depending on transitions and other keyframes, and at last adds transitions that depend on keyframes.

member.name: M:CAnimationGroup.GetGroupID
member.summary: Returns GroupID.
member.returns: A group identifier.

member.name: M:CAnimationGroup.Dispose
member.summary: The destructor. Called when an animation group is being destroyed.

Specifies GroupID.

member.name: F:CAnimationGroup.m_pParentController
member.summary: A pointer to animation controller this group belongs to.

member.name: F:CAnimationGroup.m_nGroupID
member.summary: A unique identifier of animation group.

member.name: T:CAnimationGroup
member.summary: Implements an animation group, which combines an animation storyboard, animation objects and transitions to define an animation.
member.remarks: Animation groups are created automatically by animation controller (CAnimationController) when you add animation objects using CAnimationController::AddAnimationObject. An animation group is identified by GroupID, which is usually taken as a parameter to manipulate animation groups. The GroupID is taken from the first animation object being added to a new animation group. An encapsulated animation storyboard is created after you call CAnimationController::AnimateGroup and can be accessed via public member m_pStoryboard.

member.name: M:CAnimationRect.GetAnimationVariableList(CList<CAnimationVariable**,CAnimationVariable**>*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced)
member.summary: Puts the encapsulated animation variables into a list.
member.param: When the function returns, it contains pointers to four CAnimationVariable objects representing coordinates of rectangle.

member.name: F:CAnimationRect.m_bFixedSize
member.summary: Specifies whether the rectangle has fixed size.
member.remarks: If this member is true, then the size of rectangle is fixed and right and bottom values are recalculated each time the top-left corner is moved according to the fixed size. Set this value to TRUE to easily move the rectangle around the screen. In this case transitions applied to right and bottom coordinates are ignored. The size is stored internally when you construct the object and/or call SetDefaultValue. By default this member is set to FALSE.

member.name: M:CAnimationRect.AddTransition(CBaseTransition*,CBaseTransition*,CBaseTransition*,CBaseTransition*)
member.summary: Adds transitions for left, top, right and bottom coordinates.
member.remarks: Call this function to add the specified transitions to the internal list of transitions to be applied to animation variables for each rectangle sides. When you add transitions, they are not applied immediately and stored in an internal list. Transitions are applied (added to a storyboard for a particular value) when you call CAnimationController::AnimateGroup. If you don't need to apply a transition to one of the rectangle sides, you can pass NULL.
member.param: Specifies transition for the left side.
Specifies transition for the top side.
Specifies transition for the right side.
Specifies transition for the bottom side.

member.name: M:CAnimationRect.op_Implicit~tagRECT
member.summary: Converts a CAnimationRect to RECT.
member.returns: Current value of animation rectangle as RECT.
member.remarks: This function internally calls GetValue. If GetValue for some reason fails, the returned RECT will contain default values for all rectangle coordinates.

member.summary: Assigns rect to CAnimationRect.
member.remarks: It's recommended to do that before animation start, because this operator calls SetDefaultValue, which recreates the underlying COM objects for color components if they have been created. If you subscribed this animation object to events (ValueChanged or IntegerValueChanged), you need to re-enable these events.
member.param: The new value of animation rectangle.

member.name: T:CAnimationRect
member.summary: Implements the functionality of a rectangle whose top, left, right and bottom sides can be animated.
member.remarks: The CAnimationRect class encapsulates four CAnimationVariable objects and can represent in applications a rectangle. To use this class in application, just instantiate an object of this class, add it to animation controller using CAnimationController::AddAnimationObject and call AddTransition for each transition to be applied to left, right top and bottom coordinates.

member.name: T:CAnimationColor
member.summary: Implements the functionality of a color whose red, green and blue components can be animated.
member.remarks: The CAnimationColor class encapsulates three CAnimationVariable objects and can represent in applications a color. For example, you can use this class to animate colors of any object on the screen (like text color, background color etc). To use this class in application, just instantiate an object of this class, add it to animation controller using CAnimationController::AddAnimationObject and call AddTransition for each transition to be applied to Red, Green and Blue components.

When you add transitions, they are not applied immediately and stored in an internal list. Transitions are applied (added to a storyboard for a particular value) when you call CAnimationController::AnimateGroup.
member.param: A pointer to transition object.

member.name: M:CAnimationValue.GetVariable
member.summary: Provides access to encapsulated animation variable.
member.returns: A reference to encapsulated animation variable.
member.remarks: Use this method to access the encapsulated animation variable. From CAnimationVariable you get access to underlying IUIAnimationVariable object, whose pointer can be NULL if animation variable has not been created.

member.name: M:CAnimationValue.op_Assign(System.Int32)
member.summary: Assigns an INT32 value to CAnimationValue.
member.remarks: Assigns an INT32 value to CAnimationValue. This value is set as a default value for encapsulated animation variable. If you subscribed this animation object to events (ValueChanged or IntegerValueChanged), you need to re-enable these events.
member.param: Specifies the value to be assigned to Animation Value.

member.name: M:CAnimationValue.op_Assign(System.Double)
member.summary: Assigns a DOUBLE value to CAnimationValue.
member.remarks: Assigns a DOUBLE value to CAnimationValue. This value is set as a default value for encapsulated animation variable. If you subscribed this animation object to events (ValueChanged or IntegerValueChanged), you need to re-enable these events.
member.param: Specifies the value to be assigned to Animation Value.

member.name: M:CAnimationValue.op_Implicit~System.Int32
member.summary: Provides conversion between CAnimationValue and INT32.
member.returns: Current value of Animation Value as integer.
member.remarks: Provides conversion between CAnimationValue and INT32. This method internally calls GetValue and doesn't check for errors. If GetValue fails, the returned value will contain a default value previously set in constructor or with SetDefaultValue.

member.name: M:CAnimationValue.op_Implicit~System.Double

If the underlying COM object encapsulated in CAnimationVarible was already created, this method recreates it, therefore you might need to call EnableValueChanged/EnableIntegerValueChanged methods again.

member.name: F:CAnimationValue.m_value
member.summary: The encapsulated animation variable that represents animation value.

member.name: T:CAnimationValue
member.summary: Implements the functionality of animation object with one value.
member.remarks: The CAnimationValue class encapsulates a single CAnimationVariable object and can represent in applications a single animated value. For example, you can use this class for animated transparency (fade effect), angle (to rotate objects), or for any other case when you need to create an animation depending on a single animated value. To use this class in application, just instantiate an object of this class, add it to animation controller using CAnimationController::AddAnimationObject and call AddTransition for each transition to be applied to the value.

member.name: M:CAnimationBaseObject.SetParentAnimationObjects
member.summary: Establishes relationship between animation variables, contained in an animation object, and their container.
member.remarks: This is a helper that can be used to establish relationship between animation variables, contained in an animation object, and their container. It loops over animation variables and sets a back pointer to a parent animation object to each animation variable. In the current implementation the actual relationship is established in CAnimationBaseObject::ApplyTransitions, therefore back pointers are not set until you call CAnimationGroup::Animate. Knowing the relationship may be helpful when you processing events and need to get a parent animation object from CAnimationVariable (use CAnimationVariable::GetParentAnimationObject).

member.name: M:CAnimationBaseObject.GetAnimationVariableList(CList<CAnimationVariable**,CAnimationVariable**>*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced)
member.summary: Collects pointers to contained animation variables.
member.remarks: This is a pure virtual method that must be overridden in a derived class. An animation object, depending on its type, contains one or more animation variables. For example, CAnimationPoint contains two variables, for X and Y coordinates respectively. The base class CAnimationBaseObject implements some generic methods, which act on a list of animation variables: ApplyTransitions, ClearTransitions, EnableValueChangedEvent, EnableIntegerValueChangedEvent. These methods call GetAnimationVariableList, which is filled in a derived class with actual animation variables contained in a particular animation object, then loop over the list and perform necessary actions. If you create a custom animation object, you must add to lst all animation variables contained in that object.
member.param: A list that must be filled with animation variables contained in an animation object.

member.name: M:CAnimationBaseObject.ContainsVariable(IUIAnimationVariable*)
member.summary: Determines whether an animation object contains a particular animation variable.
member.returns: TRUE if the animation variable is contained in the animation object; otherwise FALSE.
member.remarks: This method can be used to determine whether an animation variable specified by pVariable is contained within an animation object. An animation object, depending on its type, may contain several animation variables. For example, CAnimationColor contains three variables, one for each color component (red, green and blue). When a value of animation variable has changed, Windows Animation API sends ValueChanged or IntegerValueChanged events (if enabled), and the parameter of this event is a pointer to interface IUIAnimationVariable of animation variable. This method helps to obtain a pointer to animation from a pointer to contained COM object.
member.param: A pointer to animation variable.

member.name: M:CAnimationBaseObject.EnableIntegerValueChangedEvent(CAnimationController*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets up Integer Value Changed event handler.
member.remarks: If the Integer Value Changed event handler is enabled, you can handle this event in CAnimationController::OnAnimationIntegerValueChanged method, which should be overridden in a CAnimationController-derived class. This method is called every time the animation integer value has changed.
member.param: A pointer to a parent controller.
Specifies whether to enable, or disable Integer Value Changed event.

member.name: M:CAnimationBaseObject.EnableValueChangedEvent(CAnimationController*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets up Value Changed event handler.
member.remarks: If the Value Changed event handler is enabled, you can handle this event in CAnimationController::OnAnimationValueChanged method, which should be overridden in a CAnimationController-derived class. This method is called every time the animation value has changed.
member.param: A pointer to a parent controller.
Specifies whether to enable, or disable Value Changed event.

member.name: M:CAnimationBaseObject.ClearTransitions(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes all related transitions.
member.remarks: Removes all related transitions and destroys them if bAutodestroy or m_bAutodestroyTransitions flag is TRUE. Transitions should be destroyed automatically only if they are not allocated on the stack. If the above flags are FALSE, transitions are just removed from the internal list of related transitions.
member.param: Specifies whether to destroy transition objects automatically, or just remove them from the related list.

member.name: M:CAnimationBaseObject.ApplyTransitions(IUIAnimationStoryboard*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds transitions to storyboard with encapsulated animation variable.
member.returns: TRUE if transitions were added successfully.
member.remarks: Adds related transitions, that have been added with AddTransition (overloaded methods in derived classes), to storyboard.
