With FALSE this method adds only those transitions that do not depend on keyframes.

member.name: M:CAnimationBaseObject.GetAutodestroyTransitions
member.summary: Tells whether related transition are destroyed automatically.
member.returns: If TRUE, related transitions are destroyed automatically; if FALSE, transition objects should be deallocated by calling application.
member.remarks: By default this flag is TRUE. Set this flag only if you allocated transition on the stack and/or transitions should be deallocated by the calling application.

member.name: M:CAnimationBaseObject.SetAutodestroyTransitions(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a flag that orders to automatically destroy transitions.
member.remarks: Set this flag only if you allocated transition objects using operator new. If for some reason transition objects are allocated on the stack, the auto destroy flag should be FALSE. By default this flag is TRUE.
member.param: Specifies the auto destroy flag.

member.name: T:CAnimationBaseObject
member.summary: The base class for all animation objects.
member.remarks: This class implements basic methods for all animation objects. An animation object can represent a value, point, size, rectangle or color in an application, as well as any custom entity. Animation objects are stored in animation groups (see CAnimationGroup). Each group can be animated separately and can be treated as an analogue of storyboard. An animation object encapsulates one or more animation variables (see CAnimationVariable), depending on its logical representation. For example, CAnimationRect contains four animation variables - one variable for each side of rectangle. Each animation object class exposes overloaded AddTransition method, which should be used to apply transitions to encapsulated animation variables. An animation object can be identified by Object ID (optionally) and by Group ID. A Group ID is necessary in order to place an animation object to correct group, but if a Group ID is not specified, an object is placed in the default group with ID 0. If you call SetID with different GroupID, an animation object will be moved to another group (a new group is created if necessary).

member.name: F:CAnimationVariable.m_bAutodestroyTransitions
member.summary: Specifies whether related transition objects should be deleted.
member.remarks: Set this value to TRUE to force deletion of transition objects when they are being removed from the internal list of transitions. If this value is FALSE the transitions should be deleted by calling application. The list of transitions is always cleared after an animation has been scheduled. The default value is FALSE.

member.name: M:CAnimationVariable.GetDefaultValue
member.summary: Returns default value.
member.returns: The default value.
member.remarks: Use this function to obtain default value of animation variable. The default value can be set in constructor or by SetDefaultValue method.

member.name: M:CAnimationVariable.EnableIntegerValueChangedEvent(CAnimationController*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Enables or disables the IntegerValueChanged event.
member.remarks: When ValueChanged event is enabled, the framework calls virtual method CAnimationController::OnAnimationIntegerValueChanged. You need to override it in a class derived from CAnimationController in order to process this event. This method is called every time the integer value of animation variable is changed.
member.param: A pointer to parent controller.
TRUE - enable event, FALSE - disable event.

member.name: M:CAnimationVariable.EnableValueChangedEvent(CAnimationController*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Enables or disables the ValueChanged event.
member.remarks: When ValueChanged event is enabled, the framework calls virtual method CAnimationController::OnAnimationValueChanged. You need to override it in a class derived from CAnimationController in order to process this event. This method is called every time the value of animation variable is changed.
member.param: A pointer to parent controller.
TRUE - enable event, FALSE - disable event.

member.name: M:CAnimationVariable.ApplyTransitions(CAnimationController*,IUIAnimationStoryboard*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds transitions from the internal list to storyboard.
member.remarks: This method adds transitions from the internal list to storyboard. It's called from the top level code several times to add transitions that do not depend on keyframes and add transitions that depend on keyframes. If the underlying animation variable COM object has not been created, this method creates it at this stage.
member.param: A pointer to parent animation controller.
A pointer to storyboard.
TRUE, if this method should add transitions that depend on keyframes.

member.name: M:CAnimationVariable.ClearTransitions(System.Int32)
member.summary: Clears transitions.
member.remarks: This method removes all transitions from the internal list of transitions. If bAutodestroy is TRUE, or m_bAutodestroyTransitions is TRUE, then transitions are deleted. Otherwise the caller should deallocate the transition objects.
member.param: Specifies whether this method should delete transition objects.

member.name: M:CAnimationVariable.AddTransition(CBaseTransition*)
member.summary: Adds a transition.
member.remarks: This method is called to add a transition to the internal list of transitions to be applied to the animation variable. This list should be cleared when an animation has been scheduled.
member.param: A pointer to a transition to add.

member.remarks: This class implements an animation keyframe. A keyframe represents a moment in time within a storyboard and can be used to specify the start and end times of transitions. A keyframe may be based on other keyframe and have an offset (in seconds) from it, or may be based on a transition and represent a moment in time when this transition ends.

member.name: T:CBaseKeyFrame
member.summary: Implements basic functionality of keyframe.
member.remarks: Encapsulates UI_ANIMATION_KEYFRAME variable. Serves as a base class for any keyframe implementation. A keyframe represents a moment in time within a storyboard and can be used to specify the start and end times of transitions. There are two types of keyframes - keyframes added to storyboard at the specified offset (in time), or keyframes added after specified transition. Because durations of some transitions can't be known before animation starts, the actual values of some keyframes are determined at runtime only. Because keyframes may depend on transitions, which in their turn depend on keyframes, it's important to prevent infinite recursions when building keyframe chains.

member.name: F:CBaseTransition.m_bAdded
member.summary: Specifies whether a transition has been added to a storyboard.

member.name: F:CBaseTransition.m_pRelatedVariable
member.summary: A pointer to an animation variable, which is animated with the transition stored in m_transition.

member.name: F:CBaseTransition.m_pEndKeyframe
member.summary: Stores a pointer to the keyframe that specifies the end of the transition.

member.name: F:CBaseTransition.m_pStartKeyframe
member.summary: Stores a pointer to the keyframe that specifies the beginning of the transition.

member.name: F:CBaseTransition.m_transition
member.summary: Stores a pointer to IUIAnimationTransition. NULL if a COM transition object has not been created.

member.name: F:CBaseTransition.m_type
member.summary: Stores the transition type.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.AddToStoryboardAtKeyframes(IUIAnimationStoryboard*)
member.summary: Adds a transition to a storyboard.
member.returns: TRUE, if transition was successfully added to a storyboard.
member.remarks: Applies the transition to the related variable in the storyboard. If the start keyframe was specified, the transition begins at that keyframe. If the end keyframe was specified, the transition begins at the start keyframe and and stops at the end keyframe. If the transition was created with a duration parameter specified, that duration is overwritten with the duration of time between the start and end keyframes. If no keyframe was specified, the transition is appended to the transition added most recently to the variable.
member.param: A pointer to storyboard, which will animate the related variable.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.AddToStoryboard(IUIAnimationStoryboard*)
member.summary: Adds a transition to a storyboard.
member.returns: TRUE, if transition was successfully added to a storyboard.
member.remarks: Applies the transition to the related variable in the storyboard. If this is the first transition applied to this variable in this storyboard, the transition begins at the start of the storyboard. Otherwise, the transition is appended to the transition added most recently to the variable.
member.param: A pointer to storyboard, which will animate the related variable.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.GetRelatedVariable
member.summary: Returns a pointer to related variable.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.SetRelatedVariable(CAnimationVariable*)
member.summary: Establishes a relationship between animation variable and transition.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.GetEndKeyframe
member.summary: Returns start keyframe.
member.returns: A valid pointer to a keyframe, or NULL if a transition should not be inserted between keyframes.
member.remarks: This method can be used to access a keyframe object that was previously set by SetKeyframes. It's called by top level code when transitions are being added to storyboard.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.GetStartKeyframe
member.summary: Returns start keyframe.
member.returns: A valid pointer to a keyframe, or NULL if a transition should not start after a keyframe.
member.remarks: This method can be used to access a keyframe object that was previously set by SetKeyframes. It's called by top level code when transitions are being added to storyboard.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.IsAdded
member.summary: Tells whether a transition has been added to a storyboard.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if a transition has been added to a storyboard, otherwise FALSE.
member.remarks: This flag is set internally when the top level code adds transitions to storyboard.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.SetKeyframes(CBaseKeyFrame*,CBaseKeyFrame*)
member.summary: Sets keyframes for a transition.
member.remarks: This method tells the transition to start after specified keyframe and, optionally, if pEnd is not NULL, end before the specified keyframe. If the transition was created with a duration parameter specified, that duration is overwritten with the duration of time between the start and end keyframes.
member.param: A keyframe that specifies the beginning of the transition.
A keyframe that specifies the end of the transition.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.GetTransition
member.summary: Returns a pointer to underlying COM transition object.
member.returns: A valid pointer to IUIAnimationTransition or NULL if underlying transition can't be created.
member.remarks: It's an accessor method to underlying COM transition object. It doesn't instantiates the underlying IUIAnimationTransition COM object if it wasn't created.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.GetTransition(IUIAnimationTransitionLibrary*,IUIAnimationTransitionFactory*)
member.summary: Returns a pointer to underlying COM transition object.
member.returns: A valid pointer to IUIAnimationTransition or NULL if underlying transition can't be created.
member.remarks: This method returns a pointer to underlying COM transition object and creates it if necessary.
member.param: A pointer to transition library, which creates standard transitions. It can be NULL for custom transitions.
A pointer to transition factory, which creates custom transitions. It can be NULL for standard transitions.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.Create(IUIAnimationTransitionLibrary*,IUIAnimationTransitionFactory*)
member.summary: Creates a COM transition.
member.returns: TRUE if a transition COM object was created successfully; otherwise FALSE.
member.remarks: This is a pure virtual function that must be overridden in a derived class. It's called by the framework to instantiate the underlying COM transition object.
member.param: A pointer to transition library, which creates standard transitions. It can be NULL for custom transitions.
A pointer to transition factory, which creates custom transitions. It can be NULL for standard transitions.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.GetType
member.summary: Returns transition type.
member.returns: One of TRANSITION_TYPE enumerated values.

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.Clear

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.Dispose

member.name: M:CBaseTransition.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a base transtion object.

member.name: T:CBaseTransition.TRANSITION_TYPE
member.summary: Defines the transition types currently supported by the MFC implementation of Windows Animation API.
member.remarks: A transition type is set in the constructor of specific transition. For example, CSinusoidalTransitionFromRange sets its type to SINUSOIDAL_FROM_RANGE.

member.name: T:CBaseTransition

member.name: M:WriteEntSel(DB_LIST_ENT*,System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: Sets and/or clears the selection bit(s) of an entity.
member.remarks:
Call this function to set or clear an entity's selection bits. If the state of either ALIVE_BIT or BLANK_BIT changes, the database will be dirtied. The argument "mask" identifies which bits are to be modified whereas "sel" contains the values of those bits. Examples:
WriteEntSel (eptr, SELECT_BIT, SELECT_BIT) // Set SELECT_BIT WriteEntSel (eptr, SELECT_BIT, 0) // Clear SELECT_BIT WriteEntSel (eptr, SELECT_BIT | TEMP_BIT, TEMP_BIT) // Set TEMP_BIT and clear SELECT_BIT
member.param: Entity eptr.
Mask of selection bits to set and/or clear.
Value of selection bits identified by mask.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Support.SearchManager.SelectAllGeometryOnLevel(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the 'select' bit ON all entities on the specified level.
member.remarks: This only affects geometry that is already committed to Mastercam's database! It does NOT effect the state of any .NET geometry objects. That is why it can be "fast".
member.param: The Level# to select all geometry.
true to clear existing selection before doing the new selection.
member.returns: The number of entities found and set as 'selected'.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Support.SearchManager.IsAnyGroups(System.String,Mastercam.Support.Group,Mastercam.Database.Types.ProductType)
member.summary: This method is used to determine if there are any specified toolpath groups in the current Mastercam part file.
member.remarks: While the 'GetGroups' search manager methods can be used to determine if any toolpath groups exist, this method can be an order of magnitude faster than actually searching for all of the matching toolpath groups and returning them.
member.param: The name of the groups to look for.
The object representing the Mastercam group that is the parent of all the subgroups to look for.
The type of machine all of the returned groups should come from.
member.returns: A boolean flag indicating whether there are any toolpath groups in the current part file with the matching parameters.

member.name: M:Mastercam.IO.SelectionManager.AskForPoint(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Mastercam.Database.Geometry@,Mastercam.IO.Types.PointMask@,Mastercam.Math.Point3D@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Ask the user to select a point or point position on an entity.
member.remarks: The main purpose of this method is to allow user selection for the creation of Associative Points. As some PointMasks are not usable for the creation of an AssociativePoint (Intersect, Sketch, etc.), the PostMask returned will be PointMask::PointGeometry for those "invalid" cases. In these cases'allowCreatePoint = true' must be set for a Point entity to be created and assigned to the Geometry out value.
member.param: The prompt text to display.
True to allow creating a point if needed.
True to allow selection on Solids.
[out] If non-null, the associated geometry entity that was selected.
[out] Type of the point pick (See remarks!).
[out] The point in world coordinates.
[out] The 'T' values of the pick location.
member.returns: true if it succeeds, false if it fails.

member.name: M:Mastercam.IO.SelectionManager.AskForPoint(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Mastercam.Database.Geometry@,Mastercam.IO.Types.PointMask@,Mastercam.Math.Point3D@)
member.summary: Ask the user to select a point or point position on an entity.
member.remarks: The main purpose of this method is to allow user selection for the creation of Associative Points. As some PointMasks are not usable for the creation of an AssociativePoint (Intersect, Sketch, etc.), the PostMask returned will be PointMask::PointGeometry for those "invalid" cases. In these cases'allowCreatePoint = true' must be set for a Point entity to be created and assigned to the Geometry out value.
member.param: The prompt text to display.
True to allow creating a point if needed.
True to allow selection on Solids.
[out] If non-null, the associated geometry entity that was selected.
[out] Type of the point pick (See remarks!).
[out] The point in world coordinates.
member.returns: true if it succeeds, false if it fails.

member.name: M:Mastercam.IO.SelectionManager.AskForPoint(System.String,Mastercam.IO.Types.PointMask,Mastercam.Math.Point3D@)
member.summary: This method asks the user to select or create a point.
member.param: The text to display to the user as they're selecting the point.
The point mask to use during point selection creation. Use the PointMask Null value if no point masking is to be used.
This should be a valid point object which will be set to the returned point coordinates if successful.
member.returns: True if the point was selected or created successfully, else false if not.

member.summary: Type library.

member.name: P:Mastercam.Operations.ContourOperation.ContourSubtype
member.summary: This is the contour subtype being used in the current contour toolpath operation.
member.remarks: Trying to assign a 2D subtype to a contour operation with 3D chain geometry will result in an exception, and vice-versa. Use the ChainManager::IsChain2D() method to ensure you assign the appropriate contour subtypes.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.ContourOperation.SetChainArray(Mastercam.Database.Chain[])
member.summary: This method takes the array passed in and copies it's contents into the internal chain array for this operation.
member.remarks: If 2D chain geometry is passed in and the contour operation has a 3D subtype it will be automatically updated to a Basic2D subtype and vice-versa.
member.param: The array of new chains.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.ContourOperation.IsSubtype3D(Mastercam.Operations.Types.ContourSubtypeType)
member.summary: This method examines whether or not a contour subtype is a valid 3D subtype.
member.param: The contour subtype value to test.
member.returns: True if the subtype is a valid 3D subtype, else false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.ContourOperation.IsSubtype3D
member.summary: This method examines whether the contour subtype in the current operation is a valid 3D subtype.
member.returns: True if the subtype is a valid 3D subtype, False if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.ContourOperation.IsSubtype2D(Mastercam.Operations.Types.ContourSubtypeType)
member.summary: This method examines whether or not a contour subtype is a valid 2D subtype.

member.returns: True if the subtype is a valid 2D subtype, else false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.ContourOperation.Commit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method commits the current Contour operation to the Mastercam database.
member.param: true to update any chains assigned to the operation.
member.remarks: If you know that you've not altered the chains used by this operation, you may wish to used this >.Commit(false).
member.returns: True if the database commit was successful and false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.ContourOperation.Commit
member.summary: This method commits the current Contour operation to the Mastercam database.
member.remarks: This commit also updates any the chains used by this operation. If you know that do not want the chains touched during the commit, you may wish to use the .Commit(false) method overload.
member.returns: True if the database commit was successful and false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.ContourOperation.CommitOperation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Commits the operation.
member.param: true to include, false to exclude touching the chains during the commit.
member.returns: true if it succeeds, false if it fails.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.ContourOperation.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ContourOperation class.
member.remarks:
Attempts to retrieve an operation entity with the given ID from the Mastercam database and use that to initialize this operation object.
If no matching operation entity is found in the Mastercam database, the object is initialized to default values.
member.param: The ID of the operation entity to look up in the Mastercam database.

member.summary: Loads the default values for a given operation object.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.PocketOperation.Commit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method commits the current Pocket operation to the Mastercam database.
member.param: true to update any chains assigned to the operation.
member.remarks: If you know that you've not altered the chains used by this operation, you may wish to used this >.Commit(false).
member.returns: True if the database commit was successful and false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Operations.PocketOperation.Commit
member.summary: This method commits the current Pocket operation to the Mastercam database.
member.remarks: This commit also updates any the chains used by this operation. If you know that do not want the chains touched during the commit, you may wish to use the .Commit(false) method overload.
member.returns: True if the database commit was successful and false if not.

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the NURBSCurve object.
member.remarks: In order to retrieve this information the NURBSCurve entity MUST be Committed to Mastercam's database. (If that cannot be done, this will return a value of -1.0)

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.IsUniform
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the NURBSCurve is 'uniform'.

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.IsPeriodic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the NURBSCurve is 'periodic'.

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.IsNonRational
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the NURBSCurve is 'non-rational'.

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.IsClosed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the NURBSCurve is 'closed' (endpoints are equal).

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.IsPlanar
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the NURBSCurve is 'planar'.

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.Dimension
member.summary: Gets the dimension of the NURBSCurve.
member.remarks: In order to retrieve this information the NURBSCurve entity MUST be Committed to Mastercam's database. (If that cannot be done, this value will be -1.)

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.Degree
member.summary: Gets the degree of the NURBSCurve.
member.remarks: In order to retrieve this information the NURBSCurve entity MUST be Committed to Mastercam's database. (If that cannot be done, this value will be -1.)

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.ControlPointsCount
member.summary: Gets the number of knots in the NURBSCurve.
member.remarks: In order to retrieve this information the NURBSCurve entity MUST be Committed to Mastercam's database. (If that cannot be done, this value will be -1.)

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.KnotsCount
member.summary: Gets the number of knots in the NURBSCurve.
member.remarks: In order to retrieve this information the NURBSCurve entity MUST be Committed to Mastercam's database. (If that cannot be done, this value will be -1.)

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.Normal
member.summary: Gets the Normal the NURBSCurve.
member.remarks: If curve is planar, this is the normal to plane of curve. In order to retrieve this information the NURBSCurve entity MUST be Committed to Mastercam's database. (If that cannot be done, the values of this point will be all zeros.)

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.MaxCurvature
member.summary: Gets the maximum curvature of the NURBSCurve.
member.remarks: In order to retrieve this information the NURBSCurve entity MUST be Committed to Mastercam's database. (If that cannot be done, this will return a value of -1.0)

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.Knots
member.summary: Gets the list of Knots in the NURBS Curve.
member.remarks: In order to retrieve this information the NURBSCurve entity MUST be Committed to Mastercam's database. (If that cannot be done, this will return an empty list).

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.ControlPoints
member.summary: Gets the list of Control Points of the NURBS Curve.
member.remarks: These are the Control Points in the actual NURBS Curve geometry object, NOT the user supplied points used at the time creation of the NURBS Curve!

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.NodePoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of points used to create the NURBS Curve object.
member.remarks: These are the user supplied points used at the time creation of the NURBS Curve. These are NOT the Control Points of the actual NURBS Curve entity! If the entity was NOT "user created" (it was "pulled" from Mastercam's database), this list will be empty!

member.summary: Gets the last point in the current NURBS curve object.

member.name: P:Mastercam.Curves.NURBSCurveGeometry.EndPoint1
member.summary: Gets the first point in the current NURBS curve object.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.ChainManager.OrientOpenChainsInDatabaseOrder(Mastercam.Database.Chain[]@)
member.summary: Orient open chains.
member.remarks: Orients the open chain by the first/last entity ID of the Chain, but making sure the ID of the first is before (less than) the last ID in the Chain. If the Chain consists of only one entity, it makes sure that the first endpoint of that entity is the start of the Chain.
The intent here is to try to recover the data chain order in sending system. (DXF file for example)
member.param: [in, out] The chains to be oriented.
member.returns: The number of chains that were oriented.

member.param: The array of s to be sorted.
What data of the Chain are we sorting on?.
The sort order; Ascending or Descending.
member.remarks: If the supplied array contains 0 or 1 chain, no sort is performed.
member.returns: true if it sorted anything, false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.ChainManager.ChainAll(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Mastercam.Database.MCView,Mastercam.Database.Types.ChainDirectionType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Chains all of the geometry in the part file, taking into consideration the specified of parameters.
member.param: If true, only closed chains will be returned.
If true, only geometry at Z depth zero will be chained.

If a valid view object is passed in, only geometry in this view at Z0 will be chained*.
Please note! Specifying a (non-null) view in essence sets the "only Z depth zero" mask to be true in addition to the view restriction.
The that indicates the chaining direction.
If a non-null value, only geometry on the level with a Level name matching this value will be chained.
If a non-null value, only geometry on the levels with a Level Set name matching this value will be chained.
member.remarks: NOTE! Since there is no restriction on Level names or Level Set names being unique, there can be multiple matches when selecting levels "by name". If there are multiple levels that match the supplied LevelNameToChain and/or LevelSetNameToChain - ALL matching levels will be processed!
Passing a false, default, or null value for any of these parameters will omit that parameter when searching for geometry to chain.
member.returns: An array of Chain objects matching the given parameters.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.ChainManager.ChainAll(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Mastercam.Database.MCView,Mastercam.Database.Types.ChainDirectionType,System.String)
member.summary: Chains all of the geometry in the part file, taking into consideration the specified of parameters.
member.param: If true, only closed chains will be returned.
If true, only geometry at Z depth zero will be chained.

If a valid view object is passed in, only geometry in this view at Z0 will be chained*.
Please note! Specifying a (non-null) view in essence sets the "only Z depth zero" mask to be true in addition to the view restriction.
The that indicates the chaining direction..
If a non-null value, only geometry on the level with a Level name matching this value will be chained.
member.remarks: Note! Since there is no restriction on Level names being unique, there can be multiple matches when selecting levels "by name". If there are multiple levels that match the supplied LevelNameToChain - ALL of those Level numbers will be processed!
Passing a false, default, or null value for any of these parameters will omit that parameter when searching for geometry to chain.
member.returns: An array of Chain objects matching the given parameters.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.ChainManager.ChainAll(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Mastercam.Database.MCView,Mastercam.Database.Types.ChainDirectionType,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Chains all of the geometry in the part file, taking into consideration the specified parameters.
member.param: If true, only closed chains will be returned.
If true, only geometry at Z depth zero will be chained.

The view to restrict the chain search to.
Note! If a valid view object is passed in, only geometry in this view at Z0 will be chained. Specifying a (non-null) view in essence sets the "only Z depth zero" mask to be true in addition to the view restriction.
The that indicates the chaining direction.
If not null, an array of level numbers to match on to be chained.
member.returns: An array of Chain objects matching the given parameters.
member.remarks: Passing a false, default, or null value for any of these parameters will omit that parameter when searching for geometry to chain.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.ChainManager.ChainAll(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Mastercam.Database.MCView,Mastercam.Database.Types.ChainDirectionType,System.Int32)

Note! If a valid view object is passed in, only geometry in this view at Z0 will be chained. Specifying a (non-null) view in essence sets the "only Z depth zero" mask to be true in addition to the view restriction.
The that indicates the chaining direction.
If greater than 0, only geometry on the matching level number will be chained.
member.returns: An array of Chain objects matching the given parameters.
member.remarks: Passing a false, default, or null value for any of these parameters will omit that parameter when searching for geometry to chain.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.ChainManager.StartChainAtLongest(Mastercam.Database.Chain[])
member.summary: This method takes an array of chains and modifies them so that they all begin with the longest side of their chain geometry.
member.remarks: This only alters the "closed" chains!
member.param: [in,out] The array of chains to re-order.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.ChainManager.GetGeometryInChain(Mastercam.Database.Chain)
member.summary: Gets the geometry (in chain order) that is referenced in a chain.
member.param: The chain to interrogate.
member.remarks:
The returned geometry are "new" objects.
If you created geometry and then created the Chain using that geometry, the geometry items returned by this method are not the same objects.

Also note that "Chain order" is the order of the geometry items in the Chain. It does not necessarily mean that the endpoints of each geometry item necessarily aligns to the next geometry object in the returned list.
member.returns: The list of geometry referenced in the chain.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Operation.CalcCycleTime
member.summary: Calculates the cycle time of the operation
member.remarks: Note that this assumes the operation is not in a 'dirty' state! This does not regenerate the operation if it is 'dirty', and the time returned will be 0.0 The time (in seconds) that's returned in the "raw" time of the operations. Any additional time (for tool changes, etc.) would need to be added to this if desired. You can use the functionality in the .NET Framework's TimeSpan to format the time as desired. See the related CalcCycleTime functionality in the OperationsManager class.
member.returns: The calculated cycle time (in seconds).

member.remarks: Note that once the operation object has been deleted from the Mastercam database it will still exist locally, and can be re-committed at a later time.
member.exception: This exception will be thrown if the object being deleted is already marked as an Invalid, indicating that it doesn't exist in the Mastercam database anyway.
Thrown if for some reason this object is supposed to be valid but the entity is no longer in the Mastercam database.
Thrown if Mastercam is unable to write the entity changes to the database for some reason.

member.name: T:CCNCMachine
member.summary: Main machine tool class
member.remarks:
This class is used to provide an intelligent machine tool database to the rest of the Mastercam modules. The class can be initialized as follows: 1. no initialization - an empty machine tool with or without a machine base is created 2. machine base entity - the machine database will be initialized from a CNC machine entity in the database. 3. toolpath group - the machine database will be initialized from the machine tool information in a toolpath group 4. external file - the machine will be initialized from an external file. As the first
CNC machine entity encountered will be used to define the machine, therefore, the file should only contain ONE machine tool. This intended for reading in a machine definition file Setting the paramsOnly parameter in the last 2 constructors to true, is beneficial for quickly loading a machine object when only general parameters are required (paths, coolant, name, etc) and will GREATLY speed up loading time when the machine must be created in a loop. The control definition IS however loaded with the machine definition in this case, as many toolpath parameters reside in the control definition.
Once a CCNCMachine object is created, it can be 'interrogated' by the software to provide necessary information, used to update operation information, or used for simulation purposes For example:
CCNCMachine theMachine (currentToolpathGroup); if (theMachine.EnoughAxesForOpType (opcode)) ProgramTheOperation(opcode);

member.name: T:MachinePosition
member.summary:
Machine Position Class
A machine position consists of the following parameters:
- name
- comment
- type
- source definition module (machine vs job setup)
- an axis combination
- coordinate for each axis in the axis combination (or no motion flag)
member.remarks: Used for: - absolute machine axis positioning - axis retraction (ex. G28) and home position moves

members.member: 0-based index of data stream for this axis combination
list of null tool change event lists
list of tool change retract event lists
list of tool change approach event lists
unique identifier for related mapped axis combination
unique identifier for this axis combination
ent_idn for wire upper guide group component list
ent_idn for wire upper guides
ent_idn for lists of components (this list is stored in the database as an ent_idn_list)
Reference points (1st array: OD/ID. 2nd Array: Inch, mm. 3rd Array: Entry, retract)
Tool change (V9 home) position (inch, mm)
Axis combination name
Machine position type and method of positioning (actual position vs mach ref pt) (it can be used more universally for other things)
Positions (coordinates + method of getting there) for all axes X7 axis positions.
Axis coordinate

member.summary: Copies the data content but keeps the original pointers and entity IDs for the parent, child, and siblings so that the original relationships between the components stay the same.
member.remarks: This function is added to support the replacement of default component in MT component library. When we drag a component from upper machine tree to the default component tree, if there is already a default component at the drop node, this function will be called to copy the data content for the component but the relationships between components won't be changed.
member.param: Source component to copy data from.

member.name: M:Cnc.MachineDef.Component.CMachineComponent.IsClassEnt
member.summary: Query if this component object is follows the ClassEnt design.
member.remarks: Even though the CMachineComponent derives from the ClassEnt, only the newer components actually implement it properly. The older component types store themselves to the entity using the mach_comp structure in the entity's union. The new components hang off of the entity struct via the u.classEnt member of it's super union.
member.returns: true if ClassEnt, false if not.

member.name: M:Cnc.MachineDef.Component.IMdClassEnt.IsClassEnt
member.summary: Query if this component object is follows the ClassEnt design.
member.remarks: Even though the CMachineComponent derives from the ClassEnt, only the newer components actually implement it properly. The older component types store themselves to the entity using the mach_comp structure in the entity's union. The new components hang off of the entity struct via the u.classEnt member of it's super union.
member.returns: true if ClassEnt, false if not.

members.member: @par Purpose: After successfully accessing permission to run BladeExpert, and after executing the functionality, release the BladeExpert NetHASP license. This will do nothing if a local HASP is in use.
@par Purpose: After successfully accessing permission to run PortExpert, and after executing the functionality, release the PortExpert NetHASP license. This will do nothing if a local HASP is in use.

member.name: M:IsBladeExpertBasic
member.summary: Indicates if only Blade Expert Basic is licensed to run.
member.returns: Returns true if only Blade Expert Basic is licensed to run, otherwise false.

members.member: @par Purpose: Return whether or not BladeExpert functionality is available to the current user based on Product and SIM type if true, user has a valid license, he is able to use BladeExpert and if a NetHASP is being used, a license will be checked out

@par Purpose: Return whether or not PortExpert functionality is available to the current user based on Product and SIM type if true, user has a valid license, he is able to use PortExpert and if a NetHASP is being used, a license will be checked out
@par Purpose: Return whether or not the MZX C-Hook is available to the current user based on Product and SIM type if true, user has a valid license, he is able to use MZX
@par Purpose: Return whether or not Art functionality is available to the current user based on Product and SIM type if true, user has a valid license, he is able to use ArtToolpaths
@par Purpose: Return whether or not Art functionality is available to the current user based on Product and SIM type doing art_product_logout
@par Purpose: Return whether or not Art functionality is available to the current user based on Product and SIM type doing art_product_login
@par Purpose: Return whether or not Art functionality is available to the current user based on Product and SIM type if true, user has a valid license, he is able to use ArtDesign
@par Purpose: Return whether or not Art functionality is available to the current user based on Product and SIM type if true, we display Art Menu, otherwise we do not display it

@par Purpose: gotta get rid of this someday NOTE: 0: Milling version number 1: Milling level (1 = entry, 4 - 6 = level 1 - 3) 2: Lathe version number 3: Lathe level (0 = level 1, 1 = entry) 4: Wire EDM version number 5: Wire EDM level (1 = entry, 2 = level 2) 6: Solids version number 7: Solids level (0) 8: Design version number 9: User type (INDUSTRIAL, EDUCATIONAL, DEALER, etc) 10: Start date (0 for no time limit) 11: End date (0 for no time limit)
@param[out] ver_lev 12 element array containing levels and versions
Structure containing Mastercam licensing information * @{
Structure for querying numbers of total and available licenses * @{

Types of licensed users * @{

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Geometry.Validate
member.summary: Validates whether or not the current geometry entity object is a valid Mastercam database entry yet.
member.returns: True if the entity is already in the Mastercam database, else false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Geometry.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the geometry entity object from the Mastercam database. It does not delete any referenced items associated to this geometry entity. See the method override that allows for handling associated items if needed.
member.remarks: Note that once the entity object has been deleted from the Mastercam database it will still exist locally, and can be re-committed at a later time.
member.returns: True if the entity was successfully deleted from the Mastercam database and false if not.
member.exception: This exception will be thrown if the object being deleted is already marked as an Invalid, indicating that it doesn't exist in the Mastercam database anyway.
Thrown if for some reason this geometry object is supposed to be valid but the geometry is no longer in the Mastercam database.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Geometry.Delete(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the geometry entity object from the Mastercam database and optionally any referenced items associated to this geometry entity. If this entity is referenced by a Toolpath, Solid, and/or Plane, those "associated" items will be permanently altered.
member.remarks: Note that once the entity object has been deleted from the Mastercam database it will still exist locally, and can be re-committed at a later time.
member.exception: This exception will be thrown if the object being deleted is already marked as an Invalid, indicating that it doesn't exist in the Mastercam database anyway.
Thrown if for some reason this geometry object is supposed to be valid but the geometry is no longer in the Mastercam database.
member.param: true to also delete any referenced items.
member.returns: True if the entity was successfully deleted from the Mastercam database and false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Geometry.Commit
member.summary: Takes the current geometry entity object and commits it to the Mastercam database.
member.returns: True if the entity was successfully committed, else false if not.
member.exception: Thrown if for some reason this geometry object is supposed to be valid but the geometry is no longer in the Mastercam database.
Thrown if Mastercam is unable to write the geometry entity to the database for some reason.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Geometry.CopyAndRotate(Mastercam.Math.Point3D,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the current geometry object and then performs a rotation transform on the new geometry.
member.remarks: Note that with this method, the current geometry object will not be modified.
member.param: The point of origin for the rotation transformation.
The angle in degrees that the geometry object is to be rotated.
The view number the rotation transform is to take place in.
member.returns: The newly copied and rotated geometry object.

member.summary: Tests to see if a string can be used as a possible view name.

member.param: The view name to be checked.
member.returns: true if view name is okay, false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.MCView.Retrieve
member.summary: Updates the current view object with any changes that have been made to the version in the Mastercam database.
member.returns: True if the view was successfully updated, else false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.MCView.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the current view object from the Mastercam database.
member.remarks: Note that once the view object has been deleted from the Mastercam database it will still exist locally, and can be re-committed at a later time. Also note that trying to delete locked system views will fail and will return a false return code.
member.returns: True if the view was successfully deleted from the Mastercam database, else false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.MCView.Validate
member.summary: Validates whether or not the current view object is a valid Mastercam database entry yet.
member.returns: True if the view is already in the Mastercam database, else false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.MCView.Commit
member.summary: Takes the current view object and commits it to the Mastercam database.
member.remarks: Note that trying to commit locked system views will fail and return a false return code.
member.returns: True if the view was successfully committed, else false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.MCView.DatabaseReinitialize
member.summary: Takes the current view object and cuts it's ties with the current Mastercam database. This makes the view invalid, like a newly created view object.
member.remarks: Once you've called this, the view object will be an entirely independent object. As such, it can be committed to the current database as an entirely new object or committed to an entirely new database. This also means that the Delete and Regenerate methods will fail until the object has been re-committed to a database.

member.summary: This is a static inequality operator overload for the purposes of comparing these math objects.
member.remarks: Note that the comparison is done with respect to the internal Mastercam value, so small differences between two objects that are less than the tolerances will still be considered equal.
member.param: This is the first point to compare.
This is the second point to compare.
member.returns: True if the two objects are considered not equal.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Math.Point3D.op_Equality(Mastercam.Math.Point3D,Mastercam.Math.Point3D)
member.summary: This is a static equality operator overload for the purposes of comparing these math objects.
member.remarks: Note that the comparison is done with respect to the internal Mastercam value, so small differences between two objects that are less than the tolerances will still be considered equal.
member.param: This is the first point to compare.
This is the second point to compare.
member.returns: True if the two objects are considered equal.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Math.Point3D.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: This is an equality method for the purposes of comparing this math object to another one.
member.remarks: Note that the comparison is done with respect to the internal Mastercam value, so small differences between two objects that are less than the tolerances will still be considered equal.
member.param: This is the point to compare against.
member.returns: True if the two objects are considered equal.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Math.Point3D.Equals(Mastercam.Math.Point3D,Mastercam.Math.Point3D)

member.param: This is the first point to compare.
This is the second point to compare.
member.remarks: Note that the comparison is done with respect to the internal Mastercam value, so small differences between two objects that are less than the tolerances will still be considered equal.
member.returns: True if the two objects are considered equal.

member.name: P:Mastercam.IO.SettingsManager.GradientBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets the Gradient Background 'direction' setting within Mastercam.
member.remarks: Changing the this setting may need to be followed by a graphics repaint in order to take effect. Valid settings are: 0 = GRADIENT_NONE (Use the Graphics background color) 1 = GRADIENT_HORIZONTAL 2 = GRADIENT_VERTICAL 3 = GRADIENT_DIAGONAL

member.name: P:Mastercam.IO.SettingsManager.GradientBackgroundEndColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the Gradient Background 'ending' color within Mastercam.
member.remarks: Changing the this setting may need to be followed by a graphics repaint in order to take effect.
Note there is more colors data available in the class.
member.value: The color# (0-255) of the gradient background start.

member.name: P:Mastercam.IO.SettingsManager.GradientBackgroundStartColor
member.summary: Gets the Gradient Background 'starting' color within Mastercam.
member.remarks: Note that this setting is now the same as BackgroundColor. Changing the this setting may need to be followed by a graphics repaint in order to take effect.
Note there is more colors data available in the class.
member.value: The color# (0-255) of the gradient background start.

member.name: P:Mastercam.IO.SettingsManager.BackgroundColor

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Tool.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the current tool object from the Mastercam database.
member.remarks: Note that once the tool object has been deleted from the Mastercam database it will still exist locally, and can be re-committed at a later time.
member.returns: True if the tool was successfully deleted from the Mastercam database and false if not.
member.exception: This exception will be thrown if the object being deleted is already marked as an Invalid, indicating that it doesn't exist in the Mastercam database anyway.
Thrown if for some reason this object is supposed to be valid but the entity is no longer in the Mastercam database.
Thrown if Mastercam is unable to write the entity changes to the database for some reason.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Tool.Validate
member.summary: Validates whether or not the current tool object is a valid Mastercam database entity.
member.returns: True if the tool is already in the Mastercam database and false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Tool.Commit
member.summary: Takes the current tool object and commits it to the Mastercam database.
member.returns: True if the tool was successfully committed and false if not.
member.exception: Thrown if for some reason this object is supposed to be valid but the entity is no longer in the Mastercam database.
Thrown if Mastercam is unable to write the entity changes to the database for some reason.

member.name: P:Mastercam.Database.Entity.TimeStamp
member.summary: Gets the database Time Stamp for this entity.
member.remarks:
The entity must have already been committed to Mastercam's database for this to be valid!
If not, the DateTime returned is the "dawn of time" for a .NET DateTime - (midnight), January 1, 0001. You can check for this by comparing the TimeStamp to the .NET DateTime.MinValue.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Entity.Retrieve

member.returns: True if the entity was successfully deleted from the Mastercam database and false if not.
member.remarks: Note that once the entity object has been deleted from the Mastercam database it will still exist locally, and can be re-committed at a later time.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Entity.Validate
member.summary: Validates whether or not the current entity object is a valid Mastercam database entry yet.
member.returns: True if the entity is already in the Mastercam database, else false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Entity.Commit
member.summary: Takes the current entity object and commits it to the Mastercam database.
member.returns: True if the entity was successfully committed, else false if not.

member.name: M:Mastercam.Database.Entity.DatabaseReinitialize
member.summary: Takes the current entity object and cuts it's ties with the current Mastercam database. This makes the entity invalid, like a newly created entity object.
member.remarks: Once you've called this, the entity object will be an entirely independent object. As such, it can be committed to the current database as an entirely new object or committed to an entirely new database. This also means that the Delete and Regenerate methods will fail until the object has been re- committed to a database.
